0.$description:
Level 0 background - Foundational surface layer. Used for page navigation areas and as a container for elevated content (insets). Creates the base canvas that other elements sit upon.

Common uses: Page headers, navigation bars, sidebar backgrounds, main content containers.

1.$description:
Level 1. Represents the lowest layer in the stack. This is the foundation that everything else sits on, like the app's main background.

Common uses: Application background, page base layer, lowest-level containers.

2.$description:
Level 2. Represents elements that sit on top of the bottom layer. Creates visual hierarchy through subtle elevation.

Common uses: Cards, containers, form fields, dropdown menus.

3.$description:
Level 3. Represents elements that sit on top of the middle layer. Creates strong visual emphasis through maximum elevation.

Common uses: Popovers, tooltips, highlighted containers.

1.$description:
Highest contrast color for text and icons in important content. Creates maximum readability and emphasis for key information.

Common uses: Headings, labels, emphasized text.

2.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in general content. Provides optimal readability for extended reading while reducing visual strain.

Common uses: Body text, primary content, default icons, form inputs.

3.$description:
Reduced emphasis color for text and icons in secondary information. Creates visual hierarchy through lower contrast.

Common uses: Supporting text, metadata, secondary information, placeholders.

4.$description:
Lowest emphasis text color for unavailable options. Creates visual differentiation between interactive and non-interactive elements.

Common uses: Disabled buttons, inactive form elements, unavailable options, placeholders.

success.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in success content. Communicates positive outcomes and completion states.

Common uses: Success message text, completion text, positive indicators.

danger.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in error content. Communicates problems, warnings, and destructive actions.

Common uses: Error message text, validation text, destructive action labels.

warning.$description:
Primary color for text and icons in warning content. Communicates caution and potential issues requiring attention.

Common uses: Warning message text, alert text, important notifications.

merged.$description:
Text color for merged content and pull request states. Provides distinct visual identity for merge-related information and completed integration states.

Common uses: Merge commit messages, pull request merged status, integration completion indicators, merged branch labels.

brand.$description:
Primary brand color for text and icons. Used to reinforce brand identity and create visual connection to the product.

Common uses: Brand elements, primary links, brand-specific content, logo text.

1.$description:
High-contrast neutral border color for interactive states and emphasis. Provides strong visual definition without brand association for general UI interactions.

Common uses: Hover state borders, selected elements, interactive container outlines, emphasized dividers, modal boundaries.

2.$description:
Default border color for general UI elements. Provides balanced visual separation without overwhelming the interface. Optimized for readability and visual hierarchy.

Common uses: Card borders, form field outlines, table borders, content dividers, modal boundaries, section separators, default form inputs.

3.$description:
Subtle border color for minimal visual separation. Creates gentle boundaries that organize content without adding visual weight. Ideal for maintaining clean, uncluttered interfaces.

Common uses: Table row separators, grouped list items, subtle content dividers, secondary container outlines, background element borders.

brand.$description:
Brand-colored border for active states and focus indicators. Provides branded visual feedback for user interactions and meets accessibility requirements for focus visibility.

Common uses: Focus rings, active form field borders, primary button outlines, keyboard navigation highlights, selected interactive elements.

success.$description:
Border color for success containers. Reinforces positive status through visual framing.

Common uses: Success alert borders, confirmation boundaries, completed state indicators.

danger.$description:
Border color for error containers. Emphasizes critical information through visual framing.

Common uses: Error alert borders, validation boundaries, destructive action containers.

warning.$description:
Border color for warning containers. Frames cautionary information with distinct boundary.

Common uses: Warning alert borders, notice boundaries, attention-requiring elements.

hover.$description:
Light overlay for gentle interactive effects. Creates subtle visual feedback during user interaction.

Common uses: Button hover states, link hover states, soft interactions, menu items.

selected.$description:
Strong overlay for emphasized selection states. Creates distinct visual indication of active or selected elements.

Common uses: Selected list items, active tabs, chosen options, current navigation item.

text.$description: Text color for danger toast notifications. Ensures maximum readability for critical messages.

bg-selected.$description: Selected state background color for active brand items.

default.$description: Gradient fade for default alert backgrounds. Creates visual emphasis for notifications.

danger.$description: Gradient fade for danger alert backgrounds. Emphasizes critical messages.

warning.$description: Gradient fade for warning alert backgrounds. Highlights cautionary information.

success.$description: Gradient fade for success alert backgrounds. Celebrates positive outcomes.

shadow.$description: Inset border color for avatars. Creates subtle definition inside the avatar element.

backdrop.$description: Overlay color behind dialog components. Creates focus on the dialog by dimming content underneath.

backdrop-nested.$description: Overlay color behind dialog components. Creates focus on the dialog by dimming content underneath.

fade-start.$description: Gradient fade for dialog top edge. Creates smooth visual transition.

fade-end.$description: Gradient fade for dialog bottom edge. Creates smooth visual transition.

background.$description: Background color for the diff interface that allows code and difference highlights to remain visually prominent.

add-content.$description: Green background highlighting newly added code lines while maintaining readability.

add-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers of added code, providing visual connection to added content.

add-content-highlight.$description: Stronger emphasis color for specific character changes within added lines.

add-widget.$description: Background for interactive UI elements related to added content.

add-widget-color.$description: Text/icon color for add-related interactive elements, ensuring readability.

del-content.$description: Red background highlighting removed code lines without causing eye strain.

del-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers of deleted code, connecting numbers to removed content.

del-content-highlight.$description: Stronger emphasis color for specific character changes within deleted lines.

plain-content.$description: Neutral background for unchanged code that allows modified content to stand out.

plain-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers of unchanged code, maintaining visual rhythm.

plain-lineNumber-color.$description: Text color for unchanged line numbers, visually subdued compared to changed content.

empty-content.$description: Background for placeholder spaces and empty lines, maintaining visual continuity.

hunk-content.$description: Background for diff section headers ('hunks') that indicate which part of the file is displayed.

hunk-lineNumber.$description: Background for line numbers in section headers.

hunk-content-color.$description: Text color for section header content showing file position information.

expand-content.$description: Background for controls that expand/collapse code sections to show additional context.

hljs-comment.$description: Color for code comments in syntax highlighting. Provides reduced emphasis to distinguish explanatory text from executable code.

hljs-keyword.$description: Color for programming language keywords in syntax highlighting. Emphasizes reserved words and language constructs.

hljs-title-class.$description: Color for class names and type definitions in syntax highlighting. Highlights object-oriented programming constructs and custom types.

hljs-string.$description: Color for string literals in syntax highlighting. Distinguishes text content and string values from other code elements.

hljs-title-function.$description: Color for function names and method definitions in syntax highlighting. Emphasizes callable code blocks and procedures.

hljs-name.$description: Color for HTML tag names and XML element names in syntax highlighting. Distinguishes markup structure from content.

hljs-literal.$description: Color for literal values like numbers, booleans, and constants in syntax highlighting. Emphasizes fixed data values.

hljs-attr.$description: Color for HTML/XML attributes and object properties in syntax highlighting. Highlights configurable element properties.

foreground.$description: Default text color in Monaco Editor.

selection.$description: Background color of selected text in Monaco Editor.

line-highlight.$description: Background color of the current line highlight in Monaco Editor.

whitespace.$description: Color of whitespace characters in Monaco Editor.

key.$description: Color for property keys and attributes. Highlights configuration keys and object property names.

string.$description: Color for string values. Distinguishes text content from keys and other value types.

number.$description: Color for numeric values. Emphasizes numbers and numeric expressions.

boolean.$description: Color for keywords, boolean and null values. Highlights special language constants.

comment.$description: Color for comments. Provides reduced emphasis to distinguish explanatory text from code.

tag.$description: Color for class names, type definitions and support types.

delimiter.$description: Color for delimiters and operators. Provides subtle visual separation.

anchor.$description: Color for HTML/XML tags, variables and reference markers.

function.$description: Color for function names and method definitions.

constant.$description: Color for constants and other static values.

invalid-bg.$description: Background color for invalid or error tokens.

invalid-text.$description: Text color for invalid or error tokens.

diff-inserted.$description: Color for inserted content in diff view.

diff-deleted.$description: Color for deleted content in diff view.

line-number.$description: Color for line numbers in Monaco Editor gutter.

line-number-active.$description: Color for the active line number in Monaco Editor gutter.

indent-guide.$description: Color for indent guide lines in Monaco Editor. Shows code nesting levels.

indent-guide-active.$description: Color for active indent guide line in Monaco Editor. Highlights current code block.

item-hover.$description: Hover color for header items. Creates distinct visual identification of interactive header elements.

item-selected.$description: Selected color for header items. Creates distinct visual identification of interactive header elements.

bg.$description: Background color for form input fields. Provides clear visual distinction from surrounding content while maintaining readability and accessibility standards.

text.$description: Default color for text links. Creates distinct visual identification of interactive text elements.

border.$description: Animated gradient border for running pipeline states. Provides visual indication of active processing.

glow.$description: Gradient glow effect for running pipeline states. Provides visual indication of active processing.

$extensions.$description: Refers to the dotted pattern visible in the background of the workspace.

bg.$description: Semi-transparent background for pipeline stage cards. Creates layered visual hierarchy.
Background color for the sidebar container. Provides foundational layer for navigation elements.

text.$description: Default text color for sidebar navigation items. Provides optimal readability for menu labels.

text-hover.$description: Text color for sidebar items on hover state. Creates higher contrast for interactive feedback.

text-selected.$description: Text color for selected sidebar items. Emphasizes the current active navigation state.

text-subtle.$description: Text color for sidebar. Provides reduced emphasis for section headers and categorization.

hover.$description: Background color for sidebar items on hover. Provides subtle visual feedback for interactive elements.

selected.$description: Background color for selected sidebar items. Indicates the current active navigation state with stronger emphasis than hover.

bg-draggable.$description: Background color for draggable sidebar items. Provides visual feedback during drag operations.

separator.$description: Color for separator lines between sidebar sections. Creates visual grouping and hierarchy.

fade-start.$description: Gradient fade effect for sidebar top edge. Creates smooth visual transition from sidebar content to background.

fade-end.$description: Gradient fade effect for sidebar bottom edge. Creates smooth visual transition from background to sidebar content.

thumb.$description: Color for scrollbar thumb/handle elements. Provides subtle contrast against the scrollbar track for improved usability.

item.$description: Color for unselected items in selection controls. Provides readable but less emphasized styling for available options.

item-hover.$description: Hover text color for unselected items in selection controls.

bg.$description: Background color for unselected state in selection controls. Creates visual distinction from selected items.

bg-hover.$description: Hover background color for unselected items in selection controls.

border.$description: Border color for unselected elements in selection controls. Defines the clickable area with a visible boundary.

border-hover.$description: Hover border color for unselected items in selection controls.

item.$description: Color for selected items in selection controls. Creates high contrast against selected background state.

bg.$description: Background color for selected state in selection controls. Creates strong visual indication of active selection.

bg-hover.$description: Hover background color for selected items in selection controls.

border.$description: Border color for selected elements in selection controls. Reinforces the selected state with consistent styling.

border-hover.$description: Hover border color for selected items in selection controls.

bg.$description: Animation color that sweeps across skeleton elements. Creates a "shimmer" effect indicating content loading states.

mask.$description: Gradient mask for skeleton loading animations. Creates fade effect at edges.

base.$description: Background color for slider tracks. Represents the full range of available values in an unselected state.

progress.$description: Filled portion color for slider tracks. Visually represents the selected value or range within the track.

progress-stripes.$description: Striped pattern overlay for slider progress track. Adds visual texture to indicate progress.

warning.$description: Warning state color for slider tracks. Indicates caution range.

success.$description: Success state color for slider tracks. Indicates optimal range.

danger.$description: Danger state color for slider tracks. Indicates critical range.

bg.$description: Background color for slider handles. Creates a distinct, interactive element for adjusting values.

border.$description: Border color for slider handles. Provides definition and contrast for the interactive control.

bg-selected.$description: Background color for selected slider handles. Indicates the active handle in multi-handle sliders.

border-selected.$description: Border color for selected slider handles. Provides brand-colored emphasis on the active handle.

range-gradient.$description: Multi-stop gradient for slider range tracks. Visualizes severity or intensity progression from neutral through warning, orange, to danger.

bg.$description: Background color for danger toast notifications. Provides visual context for error and critical messages.

border.$description: Border color for danger toast notifications. Creates definition and emphasis for critical messages.

text.$description: Text color for danger toast notifications. Ensures maximum readability for critical messages.

fade.$description: Gradient fade effect for danger toast notifications. Creates visual depth and emphasis for critical messages.

text.$description: Text color for transparent buttons in danger toasts. Provides clear readability for secondary actions.

text-hover.$description: Hover text color for transparent buttons in danger toasts. Provides visual feedback for interactive elements.

text-active.$description: Active text color for transparent buttons in danger toasts. Indicates pressed state for interactive elements.

text.$description: Text color for action buttons in danger toasts. Provides high contrast for primary actions.

bg.$description: Background color for action buttons in danger toasts. Creates strong contrast for primary actions.

bg-hover.$description: Hover background color for action buttons in danger toasts. Provides visual feedback for interactive elements.

bg-selected.$description: Selected background color for action buttons in danger toasts. Indicates pressed state for interactive elements.

fade.$description: Default gradient fade effect for toast notifications. Creates visual depth and subtle emphasis for general messages.

bubble.$description: Background gradient for AI chat message bubbles. Creates distinctive AI conversation styling.

bg.$description: Background color for tooltip components. Provides high contrast backdrop for tooltip content.

border.$description: Border color for tooltip components. Defines tooltip boundaries.

text.$description: Text color for tooltip content. Ensures maximum readability against tooltip background.

default.$description: Gradient fade effect for default card backgrounds. Creates subtle visual depth.

selected.$description: Gradient fade effect for selected card backgrounds. Emphasizes active selection state.

01-blue.$description: Primary data visualization color (1st in sequence). Use as the default first color in charts and graphs.

02-purple.$description: Secondary data visualization color (2nd in sequence). Use as the second color when multiple data series are needed.

03-pink.$description: Data visualization color (3rd in sequence). Use as the third color in multi-series visualizations.

04-green.$description: Data visualization color (4th in sequence). Use as the fourth color in multi-series visualizations.

05-indigo.$description: Data visualization color (5th in sequence). Use as the fifth color in multi-series visualizations.

06-brown.$description: Data visualization color (6th in sequence). Use as the sixth color in multi-series visualizations.

07-cyan.$description: Data visualization color (7th in sequence). Use as the seventh color in multi-series visualizations.

08-orange.$description: Data visualization color (8th in sequence). Use as the eighth color in multi-series visualizations.

09-forest.$description: Data visualization color (9th in sequence). Use as the ninth color in multi-series visualizations.

10-red.$description: Data visualization color (10th in sequence). Use as the tenth color in multi-series visualizations.

11-yellow.$description: Data visualization color (11th in sequence). Use as the eleventh color in multi-series visualizations.

12-gray.$description: Data visualization color (12th in sequence). Use last or for neutral/inactive data series.

11-yellow.$description: Inactive state of data visualization color (11th). Used for deselected or background data elements.

12-gray.$description: Inactive state of data visualization color (12th). Used for deselected or background data elements.

text.$description: Text color for Logo in sidebar navigation.

icon.$description: Icon color for Logo in sidebar navigation.

0.$description:
No shadow. 
Common uses: Flat designs, disabled states, removing shadows on mobile.

1.$description:
Small shadow. 
Common uses: Buttons in their rest state, form inputs, subtle UI elements.

2.$description:
Default shadow. 
Common uses: Cards, dropdowns, popovers in their default state.

3.$description:
Medium shadow. 
Common uses: Elevated cards, active buttons, interactive elements on hover.

4.$description:
Large shadow. 
Common uses: Modals, floating panels, navigation dropdowns.

5.$description:
Extra large shadow. 
Common uses: Large modals, sidebars, elevated content sections.

6.$description:
Extra extra large shadow.
Common uses: This aggressive shadow is typically used sparingly in UI design, primarily for elements that need maximum visual emphasis and elevation.

inner.$description:
Inner shadow for subtle inset depth.
Common uses: Input fields, cards with inset appearance, contained sections.

0.$description: Transparent shadow color. Used when no shadow effect is desired.

1.$description: Light shadow color. Creates subtle depth for small UI elements.

2.$description: Medium shadow color. Provides balanced depth for common UI components.

3.$description: Medium shadow color. Creates moderate depth for elevated components.

4.$description: Deep shadow color. Provides significant depth for floating elements.

5.$description: Very deep shadow color. Creates dramatic elevation for modal content.

6.$description: Extremely deep shadow color. Provides maximum depth for highly elevated elements.

inner.$description: Inner shadow color. Creates subtle inset depth for contained elements.

danger.$description: Focus ring style for danger states. Provides accessible focus indicator for error contexts.

danger-hover.$description: Focus ring style for danger hover states. Enhances focus visibility during interaction.

selected.$description: Focus ring style for selected states. Indicates active selection with accessible outline.

success.$description: Focus ring style for success states. Provides accessible focus indicator for positive contexts.

success-hover.$description: Focus ring style for success hover states. Enhances focus visibility during interaction.

warning.$description: Focus ring style for warning states. Provides accessible focus indicator for cautionary contexts.

warning-hover.$description: Focus ring style for warning hover states. Enhances focus visibility during interaction.

opacity.$description: Opacity value for disabled interactive elements. Creates visual distinction for unavailable states.
